text: is a railway station located in the city of Tainai, Niigata Prefecture, Japan. ==Lines== Hirakida Station is served by the Uetsu Main Line and is 44.7 kilometers from the terminus of the line at . ==Station layout== The station consists of two opposed side platforms connected by a footbridge. The station is unattended. ===Platforms=== ==History== The station opened on 1 November 1914. With the privatization of Japanese National Railways (JNR) on 1 April 1987, the station came under the control of JR East. ==Surrounding area== The station is mainly used by students who live in the area.
